steps.name: Over-collateralization Requirement
steps.content: Borrowers in Compound III must maintain more collateral value than their borrowed amount, ensuring safety against liquidation.

steps.name: Liquidation Triggers
steps.content: Accounts face liquidation if borrowers' interest accumulates excessively, collateral devalues, or borrow amounts increase beyond set thresholds.

steps.name: Protocol Reserve Repayment
steps.content: Underwater loans are settled using the protocol's reserves, safeguarding against defaults.

steps.name: Liquidation Thresholds
steps.content: If reserves fall below a governance-defined threshold, liquidators can access value from absorbed accounts.

steps.name: Risk Mitigation Measures
steps.content: Compound III's liquidation mechanism and reserve management ensure risk mitigation and protocol stability.
